history.proof: intros H_eq H_ex. unfold ex_pseries in *. apply ex_series_ext with (a0 := fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k)). - intro n. apply f_equal. apply H_eq. - apply H_ex.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K
b: nat -> V
a: nat -> V
x: AbsRing.sort K

Goal:
(forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> ex_pseries a x -> ex_pseries b x

Premises:
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
ex_pseries = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) (x : K) => ex_series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k)) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
Notation AbsRing := AbsRing
AbelianGroup.sort = fun t : AbelianGroup => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : AbelianGroup -> Type AbelianGroup.sort is a coercion
ex_pseries_R : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), ex_pseries a x < -> ex_series (fun n : nat => a n * x ^ n)
is_pseries_ext : forall (a b : nat -> V) (x : K) (l : V), (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> is_pseries a x l -> is_pseries b x l
ex_series_ext : forall a0 b0 : nat -> ?V, (forall n : nat, a0 n = b0 n) -> ex_series a0 -> ex_series b0 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_series_ext : forall (a0 b0 : nat -> ?V) (l : ?V), (forall n : nat, a0 n = b0 n) -> is_series a0 l -> is_series b0 l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
sum_n_m_ext : forall (a0 b0 : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (forall n0 : nat, a0 n0 = b0 n0) -> sum_n_m a0 n m = sum_n_m b0 n m where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbelianGroup]
is_linear_scal_r : forall k : ?K, (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> is_linear (fun x0 : ?V => scal k x0) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
ex_pseries_dec : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), {ex_pseries a x} + {~ ex_pseries a x} where ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule R_AbsRing]
ex_filterdiff_scal_fct : forall (x0 : ?U) (f : ?U -> ?K) (g : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> ex_filterdiff f (locally x0) -> ex_filterdiff g (locally x0) -> ex_filterdiff (fun t : ?U => scal (f t) (g t)) (locally x0) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_filterdiff_scal : forall x0 : ?K * ?V, is_filter_lim (at_point ?a) x0 -> (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> ex_filterdiff (fun t : ?K * ?V => scal (fst t) (snd t)) (at_point ?a) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?a : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- UniformSpace.sort (prod_UniformSpace (AbsRing_UniformSpace ?K) ?V)]
PSeries_correct : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), ex_pseries a x -> is_pseries a x (PSeries a x)
ex_pseries_1 : forall a : nat -> R, ex_pseries a 1 < -> ex_series a
ex_filterdiff_scal_r_fct : forall (k : ?K) (f : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> ex_filterdiff f ?F -> ex_filterdiff (fun x0 : ?U => scal k (f x0)) ?F where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- (?U -> Prop) ->...-> V x : K |- Filter ?F]
filterdiff_scal_r_fct : forall (k : ?K) (f lf : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> filterdiff f ?F lf -> filterdiff (fun x0 : ?U => scal k (f x0)) ?F (fun x0 : ?U => scal k (lf x0)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat ->...-> V x : K |- Filter ?F]
filterdiff_scal : forall x0 : ?Goal0 * ?t, is_filter_lim (at_point ?a) x0 -> (forall n m : ?Goal0, mult n m = mult m n) -> filterdiff (fun t : ?Goal0 * ?t => scal (fst t) (snd t)) (at_point ?a) (fun t : prod_NormedModule ?Goal0 (AbsRing_NormedModule ?Goal0) ?t => plus (scal (fst t) (snd x0)) (scal (fst x0) (snd t))) where ?a : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- UniformSpace.sort (prod_UniformSpace (AbsRing_UniformSpace ?Goal0) ?t)] ?t : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat ->...-> V x : K |- AbsRing]
filterdiff_scal_fct : forall (x0 : ?U) (f : ?U -> ?K) (g : ?U -> ?V) (lf : ?U -> AbsRing_NormedModule ?K) (lg : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> filterdiff f (locally x0) lf -> filterdiff g (locally x0) lg -> filterdiff (fun t : ?U => scal (f t) (g t)) (locally x0) (fun t : ?U => plus (scal (lf t) (g x0)) (scal (f x0) (lg t))) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat ->...-> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
eventually_filter = {| filter_ex := fun (P : nat -> Prop) (H0 : eventually P) => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ N H => ex_intro (fun x : nat => P x) N (H N (Nat.le_refl N)) end; filter_filter := {| filter_true := ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> True) 0%nat (fun (n : nat) (_ : (0 <= n)%nat) => I); filter_and := fun (P Q : nat -> Prop) (H : eventually P) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ NP HP => fun H0 : eventually Q => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ NQ HQ => ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n /\ Q n) (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) (fun (n : nat) (Hn : (Init.Nat.max NP NQ...
is_derive_sum_n : forall (f : nat -> ?K -> ?V) (n : nat) (x0 : ?K) (d : nat -> ?V), (forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> is_derive (f k) x0 (d k)) -> is_derive (fun y : ?K => sum_n (fun k : nat => f k y) n) x0 (sum_n d n) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_sum_n : forall (f : nat -> ?K -> ?V) (n : nat) (x0 : ?K), (forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive (f k) x0) -> ex_derive (fun y : ?K => sum_n (fun k : nat => f k y) n) x0 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
nary_congruence : forall n : nat, let k := fun (B : Type) (e : B -> B -> Prop) => forall y : B, e y y in nary_congruence_statement n k
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (m <= p)%nat -> (n <= p)%nat
AbsRing.sort = fun t : AbsRing => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : AbsRing -> Type AbsRing.sort is a coercion
sum_Sn : forall (a0 : nat -> ?G) (n : nat), sum_n a0 (S n) = plus (sum_n a0 n) (a0 (S n)) where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbelianGroup]
ex_series_scal : forall (c : ?K) (a0 : nat -> ?V), ex_series a0 -> ex_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a0 n)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_series_scal_l : forall (c : ?K) (a0 : nat -> ?V), ex_series a0 -> ex_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a0 n)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_series_scal_l : forall (c : ?K) (a0 : nat -> ?V) (l : ?V), is_series a0 l -> is_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a0 n)) (scal c l) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_series_scal : forall (c : ?K) (a0 : nat -> ?V) (l : ?V), is_series a0 l -> is_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a0 n)) (scal c l) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
Build_is_linear : forall l : ?U -> ?V, (forall x0 y : ?U, l (plus x0 y) = plus (l x0) (l y)) -> (forall (k : ?K) (x0 : ?U), l (scal k x0) = scal k (l x0)) -> (exists M : R, 0 < M /\ (forall x0 : ?U, norm (l x0) <= M * norm x0)) -> is_linear l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_linear_ext : forall l1 l2 : ?U -> ?V, (forall x0 : ?U, l1 x0 = l2 x0) -> is_linear l1 -> is_linear l2 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V b : nat -> V x : K |- NormedModule ?K]

```coq
intros H_eq H_ex.
unfold ex_pseries in *.
apply ex_series_ext with (a0 := fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k)).
- intro n. apply f_equal. apply H_eq.
- apply H_ex.
Qed.
```
